sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Powerful blasts rock Mykolaiv and destroy five Ukrainian army posts in the Donbas region, as Moscow denies aiming at civilians.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Dozens of flights have been cancelled as ground workers strike at Charles de Gaulle in Paris and Madrid's airport.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Yet another heat wave.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The warm weather across Europe causes flooding in Poland and water restrictions in Italy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: After two years of consolations because of the coronavirus pandemic, parades return to celebrate 50 years of LGBTQ pride in London.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Germany agrees to return stolen artefacts back to Nigeria, known as the Benin Bronzes.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Powerful blasts rocked the city of Mykolaiv in Ukraine and destroyed five Ukrainian army command posts in the Donbass region.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: High-precision weapons also struck three storage sites in the Japonesia region, according to Moscow's defense ministry.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The ministry also said that the Russian air force had struck a Ukrainian weapons and equipment base at a tractor factory in Kharkiv.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The cause of the blasts were not immediately clear, although Russia later said it had hit army command posts in the area.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Kyiv says Moscow has intensified missile attacks on cities far from the main battlefields in the country's east and that it hit civilian sites on purpose.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Ukrainian troops on the eastern front lines meanwhile describe intense shelling that has flattened residential areas.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Moscow insists it has targeted military sites only and denies aiming at civilians. Russia is seeking to drive Ukrainian forces out of Luhansk and Donetsk provinces in the eastern Donbas region where Moscow backed separatists have been fighting Kyiv since Russia's first intervention in 2014. Here in the Donbass region

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Ukrainian soldiers like Vladimir and Artem perhaps didn't envision themselves wearing army gear battling for their country one year ago.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: But since Russia's invasion of Ukraine, things are different, with many citizens feeling compelled to sign up and protect their nation from bombardment.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The morale of our boys is high.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: They are riled up and will beat the enemy for sure, with complete annihilation until we get to the border of 2014, including Crimea and all.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: It was very difficult for the boys. Let me emphasize again, those were not human conditions they had to fight in.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: It's difficult to explain this to you here, what they feel like now, or what it was like there.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: They were fighting to the end there. The task was to destroy the enemy, no matter what.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Based just next to Severodonetsk, Ukrainian troops in Slovyansk are experiencing some heavy aggression from Russian forces.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: One of Ukraine's biggest towns, Severodonetsk had endured a colossal amount of shelling to the point of surrender.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Lithuania has vowed to continue its one-year-old controversial migration policy despite the EU's top court ruling it illegal.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The European Court of Justice ruled that Lithuania broke the EU's Charter of Fundamental Rights by restricting migrant entry. It follows a damning report by Amnesty International accusing the government of breaking international law and mistreating migrants.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: As long as the regime in Belarus will use such pressure tools, instrumentalize migration and attack Lithuania, we will defend ourselves, she says.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Lithuania will defend itself and for sure continue the policy of not letting illegal migrants in. It helps us defend ourselves from the hybrid attack and this is in our national security interests.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: In July last year there were several thousand people trying to cross the border from Belarus into Lithuania.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Some of them were detained and border guards were instructed to push back those trying to enter.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Europe is experiencing yet another heat wave.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: In Poland the sun was followed by torrential rain.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: In Gdynia, festival goers were evacuated for several hours yesterday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The rain also damaged many houses in the area.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile in Italy, the country is enduring its worst drought in 70 years, drying out the rice paddies of the river Po Valley.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Rome Zoo is distributing frozen fruit, meat and fish to help animals cope with the very high temperatures in the Italian capital.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Shade, ponds of cold water and even showers for the elephants.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Everything is being done to help them cope with the heatwave that has come earlier in the year than expected.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Following the persistent hot weather, the mayor of Verona, Damiano Tomasi, signed the ordinance that limits the use of drinking water for domestic purposes, for cleaning and hygiene reasons only, until the end of August.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Dozens of flights have been cancelled at Charles de Gaulle airport on Saturday amid an ongoing dispute over wages and working conditions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The French Civil Aviation Authority has requested preventive flight cancellations and closed part of the runaway as firefighters went on strike.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: A government spokesperson said they will continue to discuss with the unions to find a way out of the crisis.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: In Madrid, 15 flights were cancelled and 175 delayed by a cabin crew strike at EasyJet and Ryanair.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: We have been told there is a delay at the security checkpoints. In principle, everything is fine. We are able to check in without any problems to London. They have sent me an email to come here three hours in advance.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: And holidaymakers in the UK are also facing further disruption after weeks of travel chaos, as airlines prepare to announce a new wave of constellations next week, just ahead of this cool summer break.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: London is celebrating its 50 years of gay pride. A vibrant crowd of hundreds of thousands turned out to either take part or watch the festivitiesion took a similar route to the original,

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: starting outside Hyde Park and touring down the streets towards Westminster.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: More than 600 LGBTQ groups were expected to take part in the march.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Over in France, thousands of people took part in the LGBTQ Plus Pride march in the streets of Toulouse and Marseille on Saturday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: In Toulouse, thousands danced and cheered the fight against shame, ignorance and violence promoted by the LGBTQ plus community.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The Texas Supreme Court has blocked a lower court order that had allowed clinics in the state to continue performing abortions,

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: even after the U.S. Supreme Court's Roe v. Wade decision last week.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: It was not immediately clear whether the clinics in Texas that resumed performing abortions just days ago would halt services again.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: A hearing is scheduled for later this month.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The Uvalde School District Police Chief has stepped down from his position in the City Council. hearing is scheduled for later this month.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The Uvalde School District Police Chief has stepped down from his position in the City Council following heavy criticism to his response to the mass shooting at Robb Elementary School.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Three minutes after the shooter entered the school, sufficient armed law enforcement were on the scene to stop the gunman. Yet police officers, armed with rifles, stood idle for more than an hour.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Five people have been killed and 44 injured in an earthquake in southern Iran.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The epicentre of the magnitude 6.3 quake was the village of Sayakhosh in Homsgan province, about 1,000 kilometres south of Tehran.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: There have been several moderate earthquakes in the same area recently. In November 2017, 620 people died in a powerful earthquake in western Iran.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Germany has agreed to return looted African colonial artifacts including

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: 1,000 Benin bronzes that will be repatriated to Nigeria. Stolen by British colonial expeditions, vast quantities of treasures in 1897 were taken from the Kingdom of Benin, what is now southwestern Nigeria.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: We all agree that this is a necessary and important step, also for a new culture and of cooperation with our partner countries in the global south that we just returned illegally acquired cultural assets of the colonial context.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The artifacts ended up being spread far and wide around the world.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Hundreds were sold to collections such as the Ethnological Museum in Berlin, which has one of the world's largest groups of historical objects from the Kingdom of Benin, estimated to include about 530 objects.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: A commemorative head of a king and a relief slab depicting a king with four attendants were handed over as German and Nigerian officials signed their joint declaration at the German Foreign Ministry in Berlin.
